sentences.sContent: Westerly gales forced the ship off course.
sentences.sCn: 强劲的西风将那艘船吹离了航道。

sentences.sContent: Firemen entering the building were forced back by flames.
sentences.sCn: 冲进大楼的消防队员被火焰挡了回来。

sentences.sContent: She tried to keep the door shut but the man forced it open .
sentences.sCn: 她不想打开门，但那男人硬是把它推开了。

sentences.sContent: ...in-class exams force students to learn how to perform under pressure...
...So I was about to say something about the work force in the region and the level of training and education...
...His creative force is seen in products such as the iPod...
...But you can't force the child to think carefully...
...You can force a child to stay in his or her seat...
...The increase of e-book sales will force the book business to make changes not seen...
...Faced with any situation that can't be solved by the sheer force of activity...
...Necessity will force the swift adoption of more efficient ones...
...the boxes can withstand massive force and temperatures up to 2...
...Two major changes—satellite and Internet radio—will force radio advertisers to adapt their methods...

phrases.pCn: 强迫地；靠武力；凭藉暴力
有效的；大批地；大规模地
n. 劳动力，劳动大军；劳动人口；（工厂等在职的）工人总数；职工总数

words.tran: 强有力的；有说服力的；坚强的
强有力地；激烈地；有说服力地

trans.tranCn: 强迫；用力推动，用力打开
trans.tranOther: to make someone or something move in a particular direction or into a different position, especially through or using great strength

trans.tranCn: 军队， 兵力； 暴力， 武力； 力， 力气； 影响力， 效力
trans.tranOther: military action used as a way of achieving your aims
